title.value: Towards Causal Representations of Climate Model Data
title.justification: This is the title of the paper provided.
title.quote: Towards Causal Representations of Climate Model Data

extractions.description: This paper explores the potential of causal representation learning to improve the interpretability and efficiency of machine learning-based climate model emulators. Specifically, it utilizes a method called Causal Discovery with Single-parent Decoding (CDSD) to infer causally-informed representations from climate datasets including emissions, temperature, and precipitation data.

type.justification: The paper involves the application and evaluation of a causal representation learning method (CDSD) on multiple climate datasets, providing empirical results and findings.
type.quote: We evaluate CDSD on multiple climate datasets, focusing on emissions, temperature, and precipitation. Our findings shed light on the challenges, limitations, and promise of using CDSD as a stepping stone towards more interpretable and robust climate model emulation.

name.justification: The research paper operates at the intersection of climate science and machine learning, focusing on improving climate model emulation through causal representation learning.
name.quote: This work delves into the potential of causal representation learning, specifically the Causal Discovery with Single-parent Decoding (CDSD) method, which could render climate model emulation efficient and interpretable.

name.justification: The paper centers around using causal representation learning, particularly the CDSD method, for climate model emulation.
name.quote: As a first step, we apply temporal causal representation learning, in the form of CDSD, to learn causally informed low-dimensional latents underlying the emissions, temperature, and precipitation time-series from ClimateSet (11).

name.justification: The study aims to improve the efficiency and interpretability of climate model emulators using machine learning methods.
name.quote: ...machine learning-based emulators trained on existing simulation data can project additional climate scenarios much faster and are computationally efficient.

name.justification: CDSD is the primary model discussed and evaluated in the paper for causal representation learning in climate data.
name.quote: Our primary objective is to harness the power of causal methods to make ML-based climate emulation more interpretable and trusted by experts. As a first step, we apply temporal causal representation learning, in the form of CDSD, to learn causally informed low-dimensional latents underlying the emissions, temperature, and precipitation time-series from ClimateSet (11).

is_contributed.justification: The model was referenced as being developed previously and evaluated in this paper, not contributed by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: ...introduced a differentiable causal discovery method called Causal Discovery with Single-parent Decoding (CDSD). CDSD uniquely learns both the latent representation from time-series and the causal graph over these latents simultaneously.

is_executed.justification: The paper includes experiments using CDSD on climate datasets, indicating its execution.
is_executed.quote: For the experiments presented in Fig. 2, we ran CDSD on this data using a latent dimension dz = 50, and inputs of time-length Ï„ = 5.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not mention a numerical comparison of CDSD with other models, it focuses on the application and evaluation of CDSD itself.
is_compared.quote: CDSD fails to stably represent emissions data...

referenced_paper_title.value: Causal Representation Learning in Temporal Data via Single-Parent Decoding
referenced_paper_title.justification: The CDSD method is attributed to a previous anonymous paper mentioned in the references.
referenced_paper_title.quote: ...introduced a differentiable causal discovery method called Causal Discovery with Single-parent Decoding (CDSD)...

name.justification: ClimateSet is explicitly mentioned as a dataset used for evaluating CDSD in the paper.
name.quote: As a first step, we apply temporal causal representation learning, in the form of CDSD, to learn causally informed low-dimensional latents underlying the emissions, temperature, and precipitation time-series from ClimateSet (11).

referenced_paper_title.value: ClimateSet: A large-scale climate model dataset for machine learning
referenced_paper_title.justification: ClimateSet is mentioned along with its primary reference.

name.justification: ClimateBench is referenced as part of the extended ClimateSet data used in this study.
name.quote: Our experiments use emission, temperature, and precipitation data from ClimateSet (11), which extends ClimateBench (27)...

referenced_paper_title.value: ClimateBench v1.0: A benchmark for data-driven climate projections
referenced_paper_title.justification: ClimateBench is acknowledged as part of ClimateSet in the text and referenced accordingly.

name.justification: CMIP6 is another dataset mentioned as a source of climate model data used in the experiments.
name.quote: ...and is sourced from the Coupled Model Intercomparison Project Phase 6 (CMIP6) (6)

referenced_paper_title.value: Overview of the coupled model intercomparison project phase 6 (cmip6) experimental design and organization
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references CMIP6 directly and provides its details.
